results.title: H.U.R.G. for ZX Spectrum 48K
results.material_description: Cassette tape computer program. Cassette, manual, cardboard cassette case and plastic cassette tray.
results.brief_description:
“H.U.R.G., High-Level User-Friendly Real-Time Games Designer”, is a program that enables you to create games. It is a menu driven utility designed to assist in creating games for the ZX Spectrum 48K and can be used by those with little or no knowledge of programming. For example, by using the ‘Edit Game’ menu option, the player can select actions such as creating a title page or specifying playing conditions via sub-menus. Utilities like these opened the possibilities for using home computers, by making programming accessible to anyone who was interested. Games created with “H.U.R.G.” are not stand-alone; they still require the engine to run.

“H.U.R.G.” came with three demo games that were created within the engine: ‘Manic Koala’, ‘Egg Pack’ and ‘Ms. Hortense’. Melbourne House ran competitions to encourage people to use “H.U.R.G.” in games design, with cash prizes for the best games created on the software.

Source: Play It Again website:
http://www.ourdigitalheritage.org/archive/playitagain/games/h-u-r-g-high-level-user-friendly-real-time-game-designer/

Last accessed: 5/05/2021

Original game developed by Beam Software. Published in 1984 by Melbourne House.

results.title: Judge Dredd for ZX Spectrum 48/128
results.material_description: Cassette tape computer game. Cassette, cover, manual and plastic cassette case.
results.brief_description: Judge Dredd [computer game]. Judge Dredd is a single player action platformer. Players move Dredd to locations of crime as they appear on the sector map and select the crime they wish to pass judgement on. Once a crime has been selected, Dredd is dropped into a side scrolling platformer where both perps and civilians roam. Each crime is given an appropriate response level of Halt, Warn and Kill, though it is up to player discretion to change the response level. Depending on the response level is the action Dredd can perform, either shouting halt, firing warning shots or firing real bullets. Dredd can select a type of bullet from normal, armour piercing, incendiary, ricochet, high explosive and heat seeking.
results.description: Judge Dredd [computer game]. Judge Dredd is a single player action platformer. Players move Dredd to locations of crime as they appear on the sector map and select the crime they wish to pass judgement on. Once a crime has been selected, Dredd is dropped into a side scrolling platformer where both perps and civilians roam. Each crime is given an appropriate response level of Halt, Warn and Kill, though it is up to player discretion to change the response level. Depending on the response level is the action Dredd can perform, either shouting halt, firing warning shots or firing real bullets. Dredd can select a type of bullet from normal, armour piercing, incendiary, ricochet, high explosive and heat seeking.
description_for_label: Judge Dredd [computer game]. Judge Dredd is a single player action platformer. Players move Dredd to locations of crime as they appear on the sector map and select the crime they wish to pass judgement on. Once a crime has been selected, Dredd is dropped into a side scrolling platformer where both perps and civilians roam. Each crime is given an appropriate response level of Halt, Warn and Kill, though it is up to player discretion to change the response level. Depending on the response level is the action Dredd can perform, either shouting halt, firing warning shots or firing real bullets. Dredd can select a type of bullet from normal, armour piercing, incendiary, ricochet, high explosive and heat seeking.

results.title: Fist II - The Legend Continues for Commodore 64/128
results.material_description: Cassette tape computer game. Cassette and cover in a plastic cassette case.
results.brief_description: Fist II - The Legend Continues [computer game]. Fist II is a single player side scrolling beat ‘em up with adventure elements. Players travel through different environments, fighting various enemies, collecting items and visiting temples to power up the character to be strong enough to defeat the warlord and free the land.
results.title_for_label: Fist II - The Legend Continues for Commodore 64/128
results.description: Fist II - The Legend Continues [computer game]. Fist II is a single player side scrolling beat ‘em up with adventure elements. Players travel through different environments, fighting various enemies, collecting items and visiting temples to power up the character to be strong enough to defeat the warlord and free the land.
description_for_label: Fist II - The Legend Continues [computer game]. Fist II is a single player side scrolling beat ‘em up with adventure elements. Players travel through different environments, fighting various enemies, collecting items and visiting temples to power up the character to be strong enough to defeat the warlord and free the land.

results.title: Horace Goes Skiing for Commodore 64
results.creator_credit: William Tang, Melbourne House and Beam Software
results.material_description: Cassette tape computer game. Cassette and cover in a plastic cassette case.
results.brief_description: Horace Goes Skiing [computer game]. Horace Goes Skiing is a single player game with multiple genres. The first is similar to Frogger, where players begin with $40 and guide Horace across a busy road to the ski lodge. Getting hit by a vehicle costs Horace $10 in ambulance fees. Once Horace makes it to the lodge and hires skiis, it becomes a ski game where players slalom between flags and avoid trees. Colliding with a tree will send Horace back to the start of the game. When Horace runs out of money, the game ends.
results.creator_credit_for_label: William Tang, Melbourne House and Beam Software
results.description: Horace Goes Skiing is a single player game with multiple genres. Once Horace makes it to the lodge and hires skis, it becomes a ski game where players slalom between flags and avoid trees. Colliding with a tree will send Horace back to the start of the game. When Horace runs out of money, the game ends.

results.title: Hungry Horace for ZX Spectrum
results.creator_credit: Melbourne House, Psion Software and Beam Software
results.material_description: Cassette tape computer game. Cassette and cover in a plastic cassette case
results.brief_description:
Hungry Horace offered gameplay based of the popular arcade game Pac-Man. It was celebrated as the first arcade game for the Spectrum. It was one of the few Spectrum games that were also available in ROM format. It formed part of the Horace series, which included Horace Goes Skiing and Horace and the Spiders and the unpublished Horace to the Rescue.

Horace is a blue blob with arms and legs, who wanders around a maze, picking the flowers, collecting fruit and avoiding the park guards, who are out to capture him. He is able to momentarily scare the guards, making them vulnerable, by ringing a bell in the maze. If Horace is able to escape capture and leave the maze, he moves to the next, more challenging level.

Source: Play It Again website:
http://www.ourdigitalheritage.org/archive/playitagain/games/hungry-horace-orginal-spectrum/

Last accessed: 17/05/2021

Original game developed by Beam Software and Psion Software. Published in 1982 by Melbourne House.

results.title: [Douglas Wilson Home Movie Collection]
results.material_description: 1 x DVD, 8mm, 16mm home movies and a 35mm film strip.
results.brief_description: The Douglas Wilson Home Movie Collection contains home movies, originally made on 8mm and 16mm film, showing life in Australia in the 1950s and 1960s. Douglas Wilson (1919–1980) was an amateur filmmaker whose films captured aspects of life in Australia’s major cities as well as in regional areas, often with a focus on public areas, transport or infrastructure projects. A collection of his films has been donated to ACMI by a member of Douglas’s family.
results.description: The Douglas Wilson Home Movie Collection contains home movies, originally made on 8mm and 16mm film, showing life in Australia in the 1950s and 1960s. Douglas Wilson (1919–1980) was an amateur filmmaker whose films captured aspects of life in Australia’s major cities as well as in regional areas, often with a focus on public areas, transport or infrastructure projects. A collection of his films has been donated to ACMI by a member of Douglas’s family.
description_for_label: The Douglas Wilson Home Movie Collection contains home movies, originally made on 8mm and 16mm film, showing life in Australia in the 1950s and 1960s. Douglas Wilson (1919–1980) was an amateur filmmaker whose films captured aspects of life in Australia’s major cities as well as in regional areas, often with a focus on public areas, transport or infrastructure projects. A collection of his films has been donated to ACMI by a member of Douglas’s family.

display_values: 15 works Approx. 1.26 hours (16mm x 1850ft, 200ft x 8mm, DVD 14mins)

details.label: Materials
display_values: 1 x DVD, 8mm, 16mm home movies and a 35mm film strip.

results.title: [Douglas Wilson Home Movies: Reel 5]
results.brief_description:
Douglas Wilson (1919–1980) was an amateur filmmaker whose films are a snapshot of Australia in the 1950s to 1960s. Douglas’s home movies captured aspects of life in Australia’s major cities as well as in regional areas, often with a focus on public areas, transport or infrastructure projects. A collection of his films has been donated to ACMI by a member of Douglas’s family.

The first part of this film briefly shows an outdoor art show before moving on to water ski jumping on the Yarra River – both are part of the ‘Moomba’ celebrations. The second part shows a road trip from Glenroy to Macedon ending at ‘Cameron Lodge’, Macedon all in Victoria.

Good views of the water ski jumping and the crowds watching from the banks. The road trip shows excellent views of small towns such as Keilor and Diggers Rest, vehicles passing on country roads and roadside scenes including telegraph poles.

Extensive views of the gardens of Cameron Lodge in Macedon including the rotunda, lake, stepping stones and family scenes in the garden.

Originally made using 16mm film.

Selected highlights list:
00:00:00:00 outdoor art show
00:00:44:00 Yarra River
00:01:00:00 the ‘Moomba’ festival on the riverbank
00:01:14:00 water skiing
00:02:00:00 water skiing over a jump
00:02:30:00 crowd watching from riverbank
00:03:40:00 title card ‘Glenroy to Macedon 4-3-61’
00:03:47:00 footage of car trip filmed from moving car showing country roads
00:04:38:00 car parked next to Keilor road sign. Good views of cars on road including VW beetle and Holdens, views of telegraph poles
00:05:05:00 road bridge with curved arch
00:05:10:00 ‘Keilor Hotel’ and parked cars, street scenes
00:05:20:00 Diggers Rest town scenes
00:05:40:00 countryside from moving car
00:06:35:00 Jacksons Creek bridge
00:07:28:00 small town with parked Holdens and BP service station
00:07:46:00 title card ‘Cameron Lodge Macedon 4-3-61’
00:07:52:00 views of Cameron Lodge and man walking in gardens
00:08:24:00 views of garden rotunda
00:08:37:00 two women and baby in lodge garden
00:08:40:00 man photographing garden
00:08:47:00 man in rotunda surrounded by lake, crossing stepping stones
00:09:21:00 group walk through lush vegetation including tree ferns
00:09:46:00 walking through lodge garden
00:10:03:00 children playing in rotunda and on stepping stones
00:10:46:00 group of children and adults on lakeside steps
00:11:10:00 title card ‘The End’
